citation.abstract: MicroRNAs (miRNAs) are a novel class of short double stranded RNA that mediate the post-transcriptional regulation of gene expression. Previous studies have implicated changes in miRNA expression in the regulation of development and the induction of diseases such as cancer. However, although miRNAs have been implicated in the process of aging in C. elegans, nothing is known of their role in mammalian tissues.
citation.title: microRNA expression in the aging mouse lung

blogs.title: micro-RNA as a buffer against age-related changes in gene expression
blogs.summary:
As we know from too many studies to cite here, gene expression changes dramatically over the course of aging. Chaperone expression rises; anabolic pathways fall; and myriad other alterations take place, many in a tissue-specific manner.

blogs.title: The role of microRNAs in aging skeletal muscle
